availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Dement (Rutherford Co, TN, farmer & soldierowner)

body.p: Rutherford County, Tennessee, farmer and soldier. Tennessee native. Son of Elizabeth Dement. Resident in Rutherford County in 1850. With David Dement, owned seven enslaved persons in Rutherford County in 1850. Resident in Rutherford County in 1860. Owned ten enslaved persons in Rutherford County in 1860. Enslaved Caroline Dement until 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Rutherford County, Milton, p. 272A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Tennessee, Rutherford County, Milton, p. 3 of microfilm.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Tennessee, Rutherford County, Browns Mill township, p. 58.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Rutherford County, District 16, p. 80B.
Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1880), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Rutherford County, District 16, p. 270B.
Tennessee State Marriages, 1780-2002. Nashville, TN, USA: Tennessee State Library and Archives. Apr 1906 - Mar 1914: Marriages 7, p. 204.
Find A Grave, "Dr. John Dement (1824-1906)," Memorial 10785547, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/10785547 (accessed December 3, 2019).
